commitResults.messageTitle: Level-0: Implement skeletal version of Vatican
commitResults.messageBody:
Rename Duke to Vatican and implement a basic greeting and exit
sequence.

Changes:
- Renamed Duke.java to Vatican.java
- Added Vatican ASCII logo
- Updated README.md to remove Duke-related elements

commitResults.messageTitle: Created a new Toronto Slang greeting and implemented an echo loop
Level-1: Echo functionality with Toronto persona
commitResults.messageBody:
Upgraded Vatican from a skeletal greeting to a functional echo bot
that reads and repeats user input.

This update introduces a continuous input loop using the Scanner
class. The application now stays active, processing user strings
until the "bye" command is detected. The chatbot's personality
has been customised with a unique Toronto-inspired greeting and
exit sequence.

Key changes:
- Added java.util.Scanner for real-time console interaction.
- Implemented a while(true) loop for persistent execution.
- Added logic to break the loop specifically on a 'bye' command.
